reviews.text: Lovely, large boulevard area around the Columbus Monument.  Linking Las Ramblas to the port area, particularly Port Vell, this is a beautiful area to stroll around - very pleasant and worth visiting.

Passeig del Colom is a big boulevard - along Port Vell - from The Rambla to Barceloneta.
This boulevard is - like other boulevards in Barcelona - impressive.
If you walk on Passeig del Colom: Take the sidewalk to the harbour-side and get the best view.

Beautiful and impressive place.
You can see from anywhere, very nice!
Those interested can also visit the local museum.
Warmly recommended.
Quite pretty broadwalk, starting at Columbo Column and stretching along the Port Vell. Very pleasant surrounding. Worth seeing.
Columbus Avenue is a wide tree lined street in the Old Barcelona. It is a very busy road, but has a lovely pavements. Plenty of restaurants, shops, cafes and bars. Recommended for a nice stroll.

A huge and impressive
Just a huge statue you see it from all directions.
There is a museum that you can visit.
A must see and be photographed.

The Passeig del Colom runs between the Plaça d'Antonio Lopez and the Mirador de Colom. It borders the Port Vell harbor.

During the day, it is a nice walk, when you follow the harbor and look at the boat. It is usually crowded.
At night, walking along the building following the Old City is les attractive.

The Passeig de Colom (Colombus Avenue) is a wide tree lined street in the Old City of Barcelona It is a boardwalk that runs parallel to Port Vell. Stretching for a coupe of kilometres, it is a busy road, but has lovely side pavement to walk on. The street is littered with restaurants, shops, cafes, bars, piazzas, monuments and such like. Along this street you will come to the Columbus monument at the end and pass Placa Antonio Lopez, the Post Office (a remarkable building) as well as other interesting sites. Recommended for a nice stroll and you can duck in and out of Barri Gotic and the Old City as and when you wish. Nice!
